channel.title: Has anyone tried making other genres besides Electronic type things?
channel.description: I made two jazzy songs in Auxy and I was wondering if anyone else had made non-electronic styles of music in Auxy. Let me know what you think.

item.source: Has anyone tried making other genres besides Electronic type things?

item.title: Has anyone tried making other genres besides Electronic type things?
item.dc:creator: mmonsieurr
item.description:
I’ve been vigorously searching for the same… Unfortunately, I think the platform itself is just not as conducive to other non-electronic styles. With those limited drum kits, it’s almost a chore trying not to sound EDM-ish. I have musician/producer friends that refuse to touch Auxy because of this.

I still see promise in the tool (just barely though) and hope it will mature in a direction that is much less alienating to versatile producers who venture out into non-electronic genres. More importantly, I hope the folks that ARE venturing out not only begin to surface, but that they get the proper attention that will make it appealing to others that are on the fence about taking Auxy as a serious tool.

I do hope this thread is the beginning of that direction. I’m absolutely dying to hear other people’s tracks that fall outside the EDM mold.

Anyway, here are some of my attempts:

• 50’s Ballad: https://m.soundcloud.com/rigozamora/act-two-a-slow-dance

• Jazzy Hip-Hop: https://m.soundcloud.com/rigozamora/unfinished

• 90’s Reggae: https://m.soundcloud.com/rigozamora/midnight-ocean

• New Jazz/R&B: https://m.soundcloud.com/rigozamora/soft-as-tongue

Read full topic
